body.p: Identify the type of study design in the following scenario:
Researchers compare the rates of autism for children who did and did not receive the standard measles-mumps-rubella vaccine, to see if the vaccine might be responsible for autism in some children.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Which study design involves recording values of variables that happened in the past?
Correct. Indeed, a retrospective observational study involves recording variables' values that naturally happened in the past.

body.p: Identify the type of study design in the following scenario:
Researchers injected some patients' underarms with Botox, and others' with salt water, in order to see if Botox (which was originally found to smooth wrinkles) would also reduce sweating.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Note that, in this study, a treatment (Botox/salt water) was imposed on the individuals. Which study design does that?
Incorrect. Note that, in this study, a treatment (Botox/salt water) was imposed on the individuals. Which study design does that?
Incorrect. Note that, in this study, a treatment (Botox/salt water) was imposed on the individuals. Which study design does that?
Correct. Indeed, this is an experiment, since a treatment (Botox/salt water) was imposed on the individuals.

body.p: Identify the type of study design in the following scenario:

Researchers classified pregnant women as being nondrinkers or light, moderate, or heavy drinkers; they examined the weights of their children at regular age intervals to see if alcohol during pregnancy results in poor growth.

response.feedback: Correct. Indeed, a prospective observational study records the values of variables (in this case, baby's growth) as they naturally happen forward in time.
